Adult_Dosing.text: 1500 mg as single dose or 1000 mg then 500 mg one week later; infuse over 30 minutes

Pediatric_Dosing.text: Safety and efficacy not established in pediatric patients

Pregnancy_Rating.text: Maternal risk cannot be ruled out

Lactation_risk.text: Fetal risk cannot be ruled out

Renal_Dosing.text:
CrCl less than 30 mL/min and not receiving hemodialysis: Single-dose regimen, 1125 mg IV infusion; 2-dose regimen, 750 mg IV infusion followed by 375 mg IV infusion 1 week later
[1]
No adjustment necessary if on
hemodialysis

Hepatic_Dosing.text:
Hepatic impairment, mild (Child-Pugh class A): No adjustment necessary
Hepatic impairment, moderate to severe (Child-Pugh class B or C): Appropriate dosage has not been determined

Gastrointestinal:
Clostridium difficile
colitis (<2%), Clostridium difficile diarrhea,
GI bleed
(<2% )
Hepatic: ALT/SGPT level raised (0.8%)

Diarrhea
(Up to 4.4%), Nausea (Up to 5.5%)
